Package main.java.model

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
main.java.model.GameModel
public class GameModel
extends java.lang.Object
GameModel class is responsible for all the implementations on the GameModel,ball and the impacts.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameModel

      public GameModel​(java.awt.Rectangle drawArea, int brickCount, int lineCount, double brickDimensionRatio, java.awt.Point ballPos)
      construct for class GameModel which initialize and set values for startPoint, levels, ballCount, area
      Parameters:
      drawArea - Rectangle GameFrame where game is rendered/drawn
      brickCount - number of bricks in GameModel
      lineCount - lines of bricks in GameModel
      brickDimensionRatio - width-to-height ratio of a single brick
      ballPos - position of ball(300, 430)

  • Method Details

    • move

      public void move()
      move Method calls the move methods in the Player and Ball classes. move Method also loads the background music and the sound effect for the game.

    • findImpacts

      public void findImpacts()
      findImpacts Method is responsible for implementing all ball and brick properties when impact is made. Implements when ball makes impact with the player. Implements when ball makes impact with the powerups. Implements when ball makes impact with the GameModel. Calls the impactWall() method. Implements when ball makes impact with the game frame/border.

    • getBrickCount

      public int getBrickCount()
      getBrickCount is a Getter Method.
      Returns:
      returns the number of bricks.

    • getBallCount

      public int getBallCount()
      getBallCount is a Getter Method.
      Returns:
      returns the number of balls.

    • getScoreCount

      public int getScoreCount()
      getScoreCount is a Getter Method.
      Returns:
      returns the scoreCount.

    • isBallLost

      public boolean isBallLost()
      getter for ballLost
      Returns:
      boolean value of ballLost

    • ballReset

      public void ballReset()
      it resets the position of player bar and ball it then resets the direction of ball movement, and ballLost to false

    • wallReset

      public void wallReset()
      it restores all the brick it also reset the ballCount to 3 again

    • ballEnd

      public boolean ballEnd()
      Returns:
      true if number of balls is 0

    • isDone

      public boolean isDone()
      Returns:
      true if number of bricks is 0

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      it goes to the next level, and it also restores the brickCount back to 31 increases ball speed, but speed cap at 4.

    • hasLevel

      public boolean hasLevel()
      returns True if there is level remaining (4 levels in total)
      Returns:
      boolean True or False

    • setBallXSpeed

      public void setBallXSpeed​(int s)
      setter for ball's speed X
      Parameters:
      s - integer value for speedX

    • setBallYSpeed

      public void setBallYSpeed​(int s)
      setter for ball's speed Y
      Parameters:
      s - integer value for speedY

    • resetBallCount

      public void resetBallCount()
      reset number of balls to 3
